content: AMAZING!! I have 5 other recording apps on my phone, including Wavstudio and Wavepad by Audacity and now they're GONE. This one makes me wanna cry üòÖ  I do have some suggestions though,  When deleting a track, it'd be nice if it were highlighted, deleted the wrong track by mistake. When engaged it'd be nice if the 4 buttons would illuminate. And moving tracks up and down would be great too, and lastly saving individual recorded tracks and trimming audio. But I can't complain coming from those other apps. Lose no quality exporting and it's appreciated üëç No glitches found, Galaxy Note 8, split view üëèüëèüëè
replyContent:
Thanks for the review. You do not get rich with such an app, so a positive review is a substitute for good pay. I have included all your suggestions in my ToDo list.
Workarounds:
Each track has an undo / redo function in the context menu, including undelete.
Export a single track: mute all other tracks and use the normal export function.

content: When I add an effect to a track it resets the volume back to 0 db. We need an EQ in later updates, definitely! We need more than 8 tracks!!!

The interface is ok if you know what you're doing but  when I imported my music file,  then sang to it,  my recording was lagging  behind (I know it wasn't me, because I don't have this problem when using most other recording/singing apps) and no amount of adjusting the time would fix it. Please resolve this issue and I will consider revisiting this app as I believe it would be great without this problem. Thank you
replyContent: You can solve this problem by performing the automatic latency adjustment. Open the menu, tap on Adjustment, tap on "A", then "OK". After the adjustment tap on the checkmark in the upper right corner in order to accept the value.

content: This is the only multi-track recorder (I think) which runs properly on my small Galaxy 'Y'.  Some are not compatible, and the others failed or distorted.  Aubade lets me record tracks, and then use headphones to play along with those tracks, adding new tracks.  Tracks can be balanced, and effects added.  NOW: latency/delay!  ALL android apps of this type have massive delays (e.g. 1/4 sec or more) in processing the audio you are overlaying.  With Aubade, this is handled by letting you specify a time in milliseconds.  This time is 'subtracted' from the new track, shifting it left, to synch it with the existing tracks. However, the key thing for me was to experiment with this time.  It will calculate a time for you based on a test on your phone - but this was not accurate enough for me.  I spent a few minutes clapping in rhythm, and trying different times.  Now the sync is perfect.
How do I get my refund? I don't see where to do it or where to contact the maker for it. It would be a great app if it didn't delay while recording I'm highly disappointed.
replyContent: You can find the contact information both at Google Play and in the app's Info menu. Simply ask for a refund.

content: Does everything I need as a music artist requires.

As a songwriter, it is so exciting to see a multi track recording studio with effects, import/export options, various format mastering including mp3, and much more, for Android. Nothing wrong with Mac, but the best of the best involves a choice, and I am glad to have one now for Android.  I found this audio studio easy to learn and navigate.  There are helpful hints that pop up and options to turn them off or on again.  It even has a drum sequencer!  I had a concern with purchasing the full version of Aubade, so I sent an email to the developer about it.  I got a quick response and assistance that resolved my concern!    As with everything, there is always room for improvement, and I have confidence that the developer of this app will continue to advance this product.  There may be other apps that will rival this one now or in the future, but with such attentiveness, consideration and desire to ensure a good product coming from the developer, Aubade is a winner with me.
